The new courtier: the tune is, Cloris, since thou art fled away, &c.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, J. Clarke, W. Thackeray, and T. Passinger., [London] : [between 1678-1681]
Date and place of publication suggested by Wing. In two parts. Verse: "Upon the change where merchants meet ..." Item at A5:2[295] trimmed. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
=======
